intro: Cyclostemon teysmannii, commonly known as the Teymann's cyclostemon, is a rare and unique plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
